interface.name: taiwins_shell
interface.description: Traditional user interfaces can rely on this interface to define the foundations of typical desktops. Currently it's possible to set up background, panels and locking surfaces.

description.summary: create a new widget from wl_surface
destroy the widget view at the server side

request.name: set_panel
request.description: Panel is the for output, any input will go to commander

event.name: configure
event.description: expected size from the server, the clients are expected to attach same dimension of buffer to the surface. Common usage like background, for example, it will be the same dimension of output. For commander, it will have longer width than height if vertical and vice versa.

interface.name: tw_widget
interface.description: The widgets sit on the UI layer, there are unique

event.name: configure

description.summary: event to instruct clients for size and scale

event.description: The server decides the geometry of the widget, before this call, there should not be any commit, as UI layer only do the position at commit.

interface.name: taiwins_launcher
interface.description: The event and request below follows the order of usage. Since this object is a global interface, it creates by events. So we have to be careful.

event.name: start

description.summary: instruct the client to call set_launcher

event.description: launching information about the launcher itself

description.summary: show the launcher surface in compositor

arg.name: exec_callback
arg.summary: callback for client to exec applications

request.name: submit

description.summary: indicate the compositor to close the launcher surface

request.description: The launcher should do the submit request before the fork-exec. This make sure that compositor has enough up-to-dated configuration buffer, then it waits the wl_callback to actually exec the application. This is the only time that compositor updates its knowledge about configuration buffer to avoid the racing, you may still have problem when one application launches from launcher, the other starts somewhere else.

event.name: application_configure
event.description:
After launching application, we could still change the preference of the application, when it becomes floating, tiled, scale, size change, etc.
Notice that this event doesn't update the buffer.
